headline: Spinach and Strawberry Salad
description: This easy spinach strawberry salad is packed with greens, fresh strawberries, and a deliciously sweet sesame and poppy seed vinaigrette dressing.

video.description: Mix the colors and flavors of summer and enjoy.
video.name: Spinach and Strawberry Salad

name: Spinach and Strawberry Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 bunches spinach, rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Toss together spinach and strawberries in a large bowl.
Whisk oil, sugar, vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, and paprika together in a medium bowl. Pour over the spinach and strawberries, and toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: Amazing

Enjoyed this salad with the addition of sliced almonds and feta cheese. As many mentioned, too much sugar. I(I should have read the reviews first!). I tossed the dressing and started over with 1/2 the sugar. Everyone enjoyed. It was a hit!

Yummy. Took recommendations on half-ing sugar amount and it was deliciious! Also left off all the seeds since I didn't have any and used sliced almonds along with balsamic vinegar instead of white wine.
I have made this salad a couple of times and we love it. I substitute raspberry champagne vinegar and I add pecans and crumbled feta cheese.
Easy and delicious!
My family loved this salad and I did to but it was just a to little sweet for my taste thats why I'm giving a 4 star. Thank you for the recipe

It was yummy! I used balsamic vinegar and not as much sugar as called for like some other reviewers suggested. My husband had three big servings and said that was his new favorite way to eat strawberries. The dressing got a bit thick in the fridge, but a few seconds in the microwave helped. Thanks so much.

Made it as is and that's my 2 stars. 

 I made it again and used EVOO. Vegetable oil is too inflammatory for your body. I cut sugar to 1/4 sugar as 1/2 c was too much. I also switched to Balsamic vinegar. 
I would not make again.
This was my first salad with strawberries in it and it was fabulous! I added some garlic grilled chicken for some protein.
Made this for a dinner tonight and it was a hit with everyone! Served as a side dish for my parents, husband and 3 boys- ages 10, 7 and 2. They ALL loved it. I added the pecans and feta. Repeat!
I only had oil, sugar, poppy seeds, sesame seeds for the dressing and it came out great. Made my kids able to eat the spinach!

Tweaks involved (disclaimer). I made this without the seeds and sugar and I used balsamic vinegar, added blue cheese crumbles. It was really good and because the berries were sweet enough, the salad was sweet enough for sure. It was delish!
Such a great light salad. Added some almond slivers as well.
Added feta cheese
This dish is simple, fresh, and delicious!!
We LOVED this dressing
Excellent salad. I added walnuts, slivered almonds, blueberries and chia seeds. So rich in antioxidents!!
Great
Excellent.
I really like it, I replace the sugar for maple syrup and I added red apple and pecans
Family loved it so much I had to make it again in the same week. I didnâ€™t change anything in the recipe.

Very good. Took me a little longer than 10 to prepare(washing and prepping spinach and strawberries) and serve. My husband raved about the dressing/salad combination. I added pecans for some crunch but otherwise followed the directions exactly.
it was a hit at our dinner party. everyone loved it.The dressing is very sweet and compliments the strawberries.
Used orange infused vinegar instead of white wine vinegar, and tossed in some blueberries we had on hand. Mmmmmmm
Very good. Next time I'd use 1/2 the sugar in the dressing. It was even really good as leftovers in the morning (yes, with dressing on it from the night before).

I have made this twice in the last couple of weeks, and everybody loves it. The empty bowls tell the story. 
I add slivered almonds, but otherwise follow the recipe.
Keeper!

I followed the recipe exactly and it was amazing!!! I would recommend stirring the dressing every now, so the sugar won't stay at the bottom.
Always a favorite to make and to eat!
Awesome recipe! Summer favorite!
My family loves this salad. I substitute the white vinegar for strawberry balsamic and omit the sugar. I also add toasted silvered almonds.

Great recipe! Like a lot of others, I use only half the sugar in the dressing, and leave out the paprika and sesame seeds. One variation that I make is the Southern-ized version- add a slivered Vidalia onion to the salad. So yummy!
Fantastic dressing just way too much quality for our liking, only used about 1/2. Saved extra for another day, win/ win. We used sunflower seeds also because that's what I had on hand.
Delicious dressing, even though after I started, I found out I didn't have any sesame seeds to add. It definitely needs to chill in the refrigerator before serving!

I used olive oil and cut the sugar in half and used coconut sugar. The oil was a little overpowering for my taste. Next time I would cut the oil more. I also added a little orange juice to cut the oil flavor.

I used olive oil and cut the sugar in half and used coconut sugar. The oil was a little overpowering for my taste. Next time I would cut the oil more. I also added a little orange juice to cut the oil flavor.
I was a bit nervous about this because I read the reviews about the sweetness, but I let the dressing sit on my counter overnight and had this for lunch the next day and it was simply divine.
Everyone loved this salad. Easter 2019
Love this dressing! The only thing different that I did was put half of what it calls for sugar and half of the sesame seeds.
Delicious my family loved it. Will make it again.
I added shredded baked chicken breast for protein. Everyone loved it!
I use Balsamic , Olive Oil & add breaded chicken. Also I cut the sugar to just a 1/4 c. Just my preference. Recipe is good as written.
This is a super easy, delicious salad! Added blueberries, red onion and praline pecans and our guests loved it. The presentation is so pretty and will definitely make again!
This is a super easy, delicious salad! Added blueberries, red onion and praline pecans and our guests loved it. The presentation is so pretty and will definitely make again!

One of our favorite salads. Ever. It really doesn't need any more reviews, but I would like to add how much we love it. For those who posted the most *helpful* critical reviews, if the addition of that much sugar is troublesome, cut it by half and it is still great. I am always amazed by people who say they eat 2 tsp of dressing to a large salad, make the dressing as written and then say it's unhealthy. Or even better, never make it and criticize it as being unhealthy. Use your own common sense and reduce sugar/fat/whatever to what you already know you know are your own tastes. Good gracious. It's pretty simple.
absolutely love this salad, and the dressing makes it!

My family loved this salad!!

I am happy I made it !!

Awesome!!
It tasted good, itâ€™s just very sugary
My favorite salad
A salad that is a treat!

This is my favorite salad to bring for a summer picnic. So why the two star rating? Because I am rating it as it is written. As written, there is was too much dressing, way too much sugar and not enough crunch. To make it a 5 star, half the dressing and only use 1/4 of the sugar amount. Okay, maybe you could use half the sugar if you like it sweet. In order to give it crunch I added some sliced almonds.. I believe that we should rate a recipe as it is written. If you have to alter amounts, add ingredients, etc, then you are making a different recipe. As written...2 stars.
Simple and delicious!!
Loved it without the paprika
Simple and delicious!

DO NOT USE THIS MUCH DRESSING. This salad is great, simple and easy to make. Easy to add things you like ex. almonds. BUT, absolutely do not use this much dressing or you'll be drowning your salad in oil. It's not yummy. The dressing itself is actually really good - but you don't need to put it all on at once. I put about 1/4 of the dressing on and it was great that way. You can always leave more on the side if people wanted to put on more, but no one will!
Very easy to make. Brought this salad to a party and everyone seemed to like it!
Excellent summer salad! Can substitute different fresh berries for variety.
simple and refreshing salad!
Very good

This is a simple and beautiful salad. I would definitely make it again. I did alter the recipe a bit. I cut the sugar in half and used half olive oil and half canola oil in the dressing. My entire family liked it and I intend to make it again this week since our strawberries are still in season.
I made this tonight and to my surprise both my kids loved it I did use balsamic vinegar which was a hit I will definitely make it again

This salad was super yummy and refreshing. I added crumbled feta cheese and regular chopped walnuts to my salad. I also halved the sugar in the dressing like others had mentioned. I brought this to a party and got rave reviews from everyone there! I will be making this again!

This is my no fail salad to bring to events. There are no leftovers and I always get asked for the recipe. Guests absolutely love it.
I substituted the white wine vinegar with raspberry balsamic vinegar, I also added feta cheese and praline pecans. 
It is always a big hit.
The entire family loves this. thanks for the recipe

Delicious and fresh...the dressing is not extremely sweet. 

I substituted the sugar for organic coconut sugar. Everyone at the table loved it!! 
Will definitely will make it again!!
It was awesome. My husband loved the dressing. He asked for it again. We also made it for a friend who just got sad news.
Instead of the white wine vinegar, I used strawberry-balsamic vinegar. Every single one of the folks that tasted it demanded the recipe...even the guys.

Followed the recommendation of other reviewers and halved the sugar, substituted honey for the remainder. Also halved the seeds. Added caramelized almonds and thin-sliced red onion. Delicious! Family loved it!
Excellent!! Everyone loved it!
Delicious Served at Thanksgiving My sister took my recipe home with her.
Added blueberries and walnuts. The dressing is delicious
So yummy ... I make it at every bbq gathering , everyone loves it
very good, cut sugar in 1/2 and was still very sweet
This is a good recipe but has a little too much sugar. The poppy seeds and sesame seeds add a nice crunch.

We liked it but with all the rave reviews I'm surprised we weren't just blown away. I added walnuts and a little goat cheese. I also subbed balsamic vinegar for the white, used light olive oil instead of vegetable and halved the sugar. It was really good and I could see adding some rotisserie chicken for a main dish.
You can cut the sugar a bit- the strawberries add a lot of natural sweetness! Huge hit at our house.

Lovely presentation and delighful tasting!
I added biueberries only because i had them on hand.
This is a keeper! Thanks for sharing
Everyone enjoyed the salad, it was very good.

This salad was delicious! I made the following changes: added red onions, avocado and goat cheese. For the dressing, I used olive oil instead and used maple syrup instead of sugar (approx. a bit less than 1/4 cup).
I love Spinach and Strawberry Salads and this one is a bit basic but good. It's a decent base recipe.. If I were to make it again I would cut back on the sugar.

7.12.17 Spinach and strawberries are a lovely combination for a salad. The only modification I made to the recipe was cutting the amount of sugar in half. I was a bit apprehensive about the paprika, but I really couldn't taste it in the dressing. If I were to make this again, I think I'd use less oil and more white wine vinegar (personal taste preference)

This was good, but pretty basic. I thought it could use a little something else, like maybe candied or toasted nuts and definitely some thinly sliced red onion. We did like the dressing. Thanks for sharing. :)
i loved this recipe and i would make it again
A crowd pleaser and refreshing summer salad! I cut back on the sugar by about 1/3. Will definitely be making this one again. Don't skip the poppy seeds - they definitely make the salad!
Love this salad, so light & refreshing. I did omit the poppy seeds due to dental issue. Roasted Sunflower seeds are wonderful too.
Would cut the sugar by half.....way too sweet but the combination is great. Threw on some sliced almonds for crunch and seemed good.
I added some pineapple, cantelope, and walnut. I made a strawberry vinaigrette. Fruit salads are refreshing.
This recipe is wonderful! I gave it 4/5 only because I found it way to sweet for me. I will be making it again and adjust the sugar to my liking.

Absolutely, delicious! What a great summer salad - light, refreshing and enjoyable. Just the right balance of sweet, tart & earthy. Wonderful! Also, Truvia is an excellent substitute for the sugar without sacrificing flavor!
I also added some candied pecans. Yum!!

Absolutely delicious! I didn't have paprika or vegetable oil, so I used sesame oil and a dash of pepper. I also added blueberries! It was delicious. I think next time I will do the same and add almond slices!
I made this for Easter Dinner. My whole family loved it. I served it with the dressing and bacon bits on the side because my son doesn't like dressings and some people want bacon, while others dont.
Did't make changes and willies it again
Excellent in all it variations - Original as well as modifications suggested...
Delicious!
I made this salad for a Church dinner. The proof was in the eating!! I brought home an empty dish!! Many raves about this salad! Thank you All recipe!
Pretty sweet, but simple

I have to agree with others. This is just too much. I make a similar salad and I don't use any oil or sugar. I make mine with bowtie pasta, almonds, and literally about 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar that I reduce on the stove until it self-sweetens and a half cup of feta cheese. Other than that mine is about the same, meaning just the strawberries and spinach. :)
Added toasted almonds with toasted sesame seeds and pomegranate seed with a oil and vinegar dressing the salad was terrific
Prepared this salad for a banquet. The guests absolutely loved it!!! Great vinegarette!!!
Quick. Easy. Delicious. I added sliced almonds and only put about half the sugar it calls for and it's awesome.
